title: Grade 4
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

FEE1C751E13149A8A191DCB9A8F8BE6D.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being
read to, and during shared reading activities including
domain-specific words.

F25C9967A7BA45EDA687C313ACE5E65A.description:
Use common idioms (e.g., no way, not a
chance, you bet).

5D23208D877A411E96379DC3A8103291.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships
and use.

023FF16BFB294E518D5E6A05EDC7F82C.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., talk) and
the words that result when word endings are added
(e.g., talked, talking, talks).

DB22CE52F14140EDA77F027330D43C30.description:
Use context as a clue to guide selection of a word
that completes a sentence read aloud by an adult.

32C19F8102D345E4A500ACAC0083537A.description: Communicate effectively with peers and adults.

900E8A3E3B834AC0A25117756C25FE56.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when
communicating.

DB28E01680BB40A8BD2C51943C0894B9.description:
Spell words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of
letter- sound relationships, and/or common spelling
patterns.

89C59FFD2B6B428EB2589C3C1994EAC7.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence.

CAD64674E54A4A949280CBB92FDFA2EA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

421E22A5F8EB43E896A8E07EFA4F07AA.description: Combine three or more words in communication.

95B51ECCDBA342F394A3842103AA04EF.description:
Use common prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out,
on, off, by, with).

0349206C376342AC8C7DF4E50F56D8B6.description:
Use comparative and superlative adjectives to
describe people or objects.

C4C908E94B0941C494B6606E71610FF4.description:
Combine common nouns with verbs, nouns, or
pronouns in communication.

1DB795048F3C426E8D0CF2D510D0819C.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

1316069FFC7445BCBCB26075968AC7C4.description:
Differentiate between communication partners
and contexts that call for formal and informal
communication.

F664F9DEBE13443498EF90DD29DF65E9.description:
Add audio recordings or visuals to a
presentation about a personally relevant topic.

917CF895C97B4EE1A58C5EC1E883B40C.description:
Retell a story or personal experience or recount
a topic with supporting details.

4A7A91E2AE5F410E8492095A02E0E008.description:
Identify a point that the speaker
makes.

DC43A57ED59C4869817DC3A3CD76175D.description:
Ask and answer questions about details from a
text read aloud or information presented orally or through
other media.

248C364FA2204C6AB9AC13E2E8820CC0.description: Identify the key ideas in a discussion.

348D98A59D7541E18A8CAEE5C91A9A3F.description:
Answer specific questions related to information in
a discussion.

28861886A1934A96AE86595EE26FAAE5.description:
With guidance and support, carry out assigned role
in a discussion.

EAE4A53416FA4B3D911D0ADBDCE1B98F.description:
Contribute ideas from prior knowledge of a text
during discussions about the same text.

B222DBD3BE3A463F8F2E0F6818CDFC9B.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

EE412052DFA542DDB63B2B95F2C80C3C.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 4 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., "Use
reasons and evidence supporting point in an
informational text.").

88C5C1D3297E481593DDEE9EB706CB7F.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 4 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Use details from text
to describe a character in a story.”).

68C03FB7AD2D4160AE7E42CC71D9D1C3.description:
Recall information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

10974F059EB84C779DB60C07ECA96F8A.description:
Recall and sort information from personal
experiences or a topic into given categories.

0238761A1E304277B601BDB7FF03C0B0.description:
Gather information about a topic from two or
more sources for a research project.

9FFC3CC4777E4574AF72B43205557009.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

13CB5B34186B4456BFAE7398824C7B07.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use
technology, including the Internet, to produce writing while
interacting and collaborating with others.

DC110470931A4E1B9EF2D95FAB035BF6.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

A322E9E0F79B4DE5B2B1CDD4B065620F.description:
Produce writing that expresses more than one
idea.

0922351017804BDBA63094C4C69E0D0F.description:
List words that describe an event or personal
experience to use when writing about it.

574CA22434AB4FF0A0791392D4B8DEE9.description:
Write about a personal experience including two
events in sequence.

866A82119B5A4ED3B7A6FE76A7972D85.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

ADC4704CA59746139C696353478516A9.description: List words, facts, or details related to the topic.

DC1A090F158D42598869BA6848FC431F.description:
Select a topic and write about it including related
visual, tactual, or multimedia information as
appropriate.

4DAA1A38148B4AB5ACB3AFAB3E8E5AE7.description: Write to share information supported by details.

7F7ABAFE30064D048216F70B5F8E5B83.description: List reasons to support the opinion.

C55F342E6BD44B46939A9586A2D7D693.description: Select a topic or text and write an opinion about it.

F937C5DCF1054ED6B7D0210AC2196F5E.description: Write opinions about topics or text.

F10F14A856B941BD8555EFC5662149F8.description:
Use letter knowledge and context to support word
recognition when reading.

5B3D03493315476681204ED87F9B7BB5.description:
Read text comprised of familiar words with
accuracy and understanding.

E988290CF0014CA0A23C92F205AF98A5.description:
Decode single-syllable words with common
spelling patterns (consonant-vowel-consonant
[CVC] or high-frequency rimes).

F57AAAE72C84487E9C8161A2A9D45568.description:
Apply letter-sound knowledge to use first letter plus
context to identify unfamiliar words.

6663D73616604674B9CD71DEE1C6DF0E.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to read words.

F48D9BFD0A084AC0808DB1017A5C614F.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

22AB2CC939A649F29F4FEF991C168A69.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in shared reading of history/social
studies, science, and technical texts.

50BCE5F4E41740D9BEFE62ABC9674ECF.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7794EA5362A34D60AB573EB444296DF9.description:
Compare details presented in two texts on the
same topic.

E22FB03C9CFD472697FD8C4E2F9C111A.description:
Identify one or more reasons supporting a
specific point in an informational text.

A049309106ED495DA63FAD88B49BE723.description:
Answer questions about information presented
visually, orally, or quantitatively.

34B6EFF443304F01B3AF8E337EC51E2F.description:
Compare own experience with a written account
of the experience.

39E113CA036E4CCCBF2218A04B82115A.description:
Identify elements that are characteristic of
informational texts.

BABFC8BFCFAD485D94DC5EB271944C74.description: Determine meaning of words in text.

E3EDC64228834611AC53EAF12E590CBD.description:
Identify an explicit detail that is related to an
individual, event, or idea in a historical, scientific, or
technical text.

BC58875AA92B47DF914AF8886984A27B.description:
Identify the main idea of a text when it is
explicitly stated.

8B913B649A394B0DA04E697936BD1B68.description: Identify explicit details in an informational text.

A13B42F28A2F4515B4AB2C4454F17F37.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaging in shared reading of stories, dramas, and
poetry.

DD692F09E6264AFDB21048B59AB593DE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

2654CE668BE8416EA84C616741C37D19.description:
Compare characters, settings or events in
stories, myths or texts.

67606E8718CB402DAB6F7E5C128F38FD.description:
Make connections between the text
representation of a story and a visual, tactual, or oral
version of a story.

AF30705EE33743AEB7DA9AA4C1162456.description: Identify the narrator of a story.

D3B165D63B7D449A955FE274A4C91A11.description:
Identify elements that are characteristic of
stories.

F9976626C1104403B81246A0EA38BBF9.description: Determine the meaning of words in a text.

A57D5992A1E34CA6BF415885A71ABBDB.description:
EE.RL.4.3 Use details from the text to describe characters
in the story.

745714E1A82C451EB231D818831B1C13.description:
Identify the theme or central idea of a familiar
story, drama or poem.

4D48BFF7CD3945618D6B53D358859294.description:
Use details from the text to recount what the text
says.
